intro: Micromeria darwinii var. typica, commonly known as Darwin's micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
